lines.line_text: OF Leinster fam'd for maidens fair,
Nor e'er did Liffy's limpid stream
Her dainty lip, her damask check,

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Till luckless love and pining care
Impair'd her rosy hue,
Her dainty lip, her damask check,
And eyes of glossy blue.

lines.line_text: Ah! have you seen a lily pale
Her life now near its end.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ah! have you seen a lily pale
When beating rains descend?
So droop'd this slow-consuming maid,
Her life now near its end.

lines.line_text: By LUCY warn'd, of flatt'ring swains
Of vengeance due to broken vows,

stanzas.stanza_text:
By LUCY warn'd, of flatt'ring swains
Take heed, ye easy fair;
Of vengeance due to broken vows,
Ye flatt'ring swains beware!

lines.line_text: Three times all in the dead of night,
A bell was heard to ring;
And at her window shrieking thrice,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Three times all in the dead of night,
A bell was heard to ring;
And at her window shrieking thrice,
The raven flap'd his wing.

lines.line_text: Full well the love-lorn maiden knew
And thus in dying words bespake

stanzas.stanza_text:
Full well the love-lorn maiden knew
The solemn boding sound,
And thus in dying words bespake
The virgins weeping round.

lines.line_text: "I hear a voice you cannot hear,
"I see a hand you cannot see,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"I hear a voice you cannot hear,
"That cries, I must not stay;
"I see a hand you cannot see,
"That beckons me away.

lines.line_text: "Of a false swain and broken heart,
"Am I to blame, because the bride

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Of a false swain and broken heart,
"In early youth I die;
"Am I to blame, because the bride
"Is twice as rich as I?

lines.line_text: "Ah, COLIN, give not her thy vows,
"Nor thou, rash girl, receive his kiss,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Ah, COLIN, give not her thy vows,
"Vows due to me alone!
"Nor thou, rash girl, receive his kiss,
"Nor think him all thy own!

lines.line_text: "But know, false man, and know, fond maid,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"To-morrow in the church to wed
"Impatient both prepare:
"But know, false man, and know, fond maid,
"Poor LUCY will be there.

lines.line_text: "Then bear my corse, ye comrades dear,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Then bear my corse, ye comrades dear,
"The bridegroom blithe to meet;
"He in his wedding-trim so gay,
"I in my winding sheet. "

lines.line_text: She spake, she dy'd, her corse was borne,
He in his wedding trim so gay,

stanzas.stanza_text:
She spake, she dy'd, her corse was borne,
The bridegroom blithe to meet;
He in his wedding trim so gay,
She in her winding sheet.

lines.line_text: What then were COLIN'S dreadful thoughts;
The bride-men flock'd round LUCY dead,

stanzas.stanza_text:
What then were COLIN'S dreadful thoughts;
How were these nuptials kept?
The bride-men flock'd round LUCY dead,
And all the village wept.

lines.line_text: The damps of death bedew'd his brow,
He groan'd, he shook, he fell.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Compassion, shame, remorse, despair,
At once his bosom swell:
The damps of death bedew'd his brow,
He groan'd, he shook, he fell.

lines.line_text: From the vain bride, a bride no more,
When, stretch'd beside her rival's corse,

stanzas.stanza_text:
From the vain bride, a bride no more,
The varying crimson fled;
When, stretch'd beside her rival's corse,
She saw her lover dead.

lines.line_text: He to his LUCY'S new-made grave,
In the same mould, beneath one sod,

stanzas.stanza_text:
He to his LUCY'S new-made grave,
Convey'd by trembling swains,
In the same mould, beneath one sod,
For-ever now remains.

lines.line_text: Oft at this place the constant hind
With garlands gay, and true-love knots

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oft at this place the constant hind
And plighted maid are seen;
With garlands gay, and true-love knots
They deck the sacred green.

lines.line_text: But, swain forsworn, who'er thou art,
And fear to meet him there.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But, swain forsworn, who'er thou art,
This hallow'd ground forbear!
Remember COLIN'S dreadful fate,
And fear to meet him there.
